name: ListExternalAccounts
description:
Retrieve external accounts linked to a Stripe account.

This tool retrieves the external accounts associated with a specified Stripe account. It should be called when you need details about the financial accounts linked to a specific Stripe account ID.

parameters.name: stripe_account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Stripe account whose external accounts you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before
parameters.description: A cursor used to define your position in the list for pagination. It specifies the object ID before which the list should end.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `ending_before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with `obj_bar`, your subsequent call can include `ending_before=obj_bar` in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

parameters.name: expand_response_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response to expand for detailed information.

value_schema.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be expanded.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of external accounts to retrieve, ranging from 1 to 100. Default is 10.

value_schema.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

parameters.name: filter_by_object_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of external accounts to filter: 'bank_account' or 'card'.

value_schema.description: Filter external accounts according to a particular object type.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after_object_id
parameters.description: Object ID for pagination to fetch the next page of results. Use the ID of the last object from the current list.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `starting_after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with `obj_foo`, your subsequent call can include `starting_after=obj_foo` in order to fetch the next page of the list.
